Comment: Those are UN recognized members (193, plus Palestine and Holy See (Vatican)). Unfortunately, that is just a simple way to count, but not a full answer. There are also non recognized countries or territories. Places during a civil war may not consider themselves united even though the UN only recognizes one capital, as we saw for years with Sudan and South Sudan. Then, there are geopolitical issues that keep some areas from being recognized by the UN, such as Tibet.   TLDR, answers may vary from about 193 to 206 and can be correct.
